description: As of last month, in the cemeteries of this hilly megalopolis in south-central China, modest burials are in. Fancy tombs are out.
title: In Chengdu, Burial Is Also an Economic Rite
title_page: In Chengdu, Burial Is Also an Economic Rite - The New York Times
text:
Burial plots have been restricted in Chengdu in Sichuan Province. Plots for ashes are now limited to about 4 feet by 4 feet. Tombstones are supposed to be no higher than 100 centimeters, about 39 inches, although it is not clear whether that limit will be enforced. Sellers of oversize plots have been warned that they face severe fines, as much as 300 times the plotâ€™s price.
